intro: Hieracium subpannosum, commonly known as the lesser yellow hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, featuring basal leaves that are lanceolate and often hairy. Its flowers are yellow and appear in clusters, blooming from late spring to early autumn. It thrives in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and along roadsides.
